page.title: 07Folk Lore of the Canals
page.content: With the opening of the Boat Museum in 1976 came a revival in interest in the life style and customs of the families who had once worked and lived on the canals. This way of life had all but disappeared by the 1960's, but memories are kept alive by present day activity connected with the Boat Museum. At Easter an annual boat rally takes place for pleasure craft and restored working boats. In September there is a steam rally,but this year the largest event was the {International Waterways {Festival}. Over 3 days this attracted 17,000 visitors. Folk traditions are kept alive by a group called "The Cut Above" folk club who perform song and dance in traditional costume.
